ygData.subject: SV: [EverQuest] hello
ygData.msgSnippet: They say that Win2000 is much more stable. XP is also an option. Not as stable as 2000 and not compatible with alot of software. I ve not had any problems
ygData.messageBody:
"They say that Win2000 is much more stable. XP is also an option. Not
as stable as 2000 and not compatible with alot of software."

I've not had any problems with compatible softwares. Compatible mode has
solved those problems that i used to have. Then again, i don't run any 16
bit applications.

"and you have to go into regedit and edit Permissions to allow yourself to
install software
on it. It is a real biyatch sometimes."

Wrong, use your admin account to install softwares. It's much better
security to have a regular user account wich you use on regular basis and
use the admin account when you are installing new softwares. That way it
will be alot harder for you to fark up your system.

Another good thing to use is system save, use it when you think your system
is running well. If you later run into problems you simply load up your
saved system and are fit for fight again.

"maybe that info would be at www.tweakui.com?"

No, it's a reg hack. Altho, WinXX ain't designed to handle very much memory
but you can fix it.

-Domi



Definetly ditch ME. Every techie I have talked to has told me how unstable
it is. They say that Win2000 is much more stable. XP is also an option. Not
as stable as 2000 and not compatible with alot of software. and you have to
go into regedit and edit Permissions to allow yourself to install software
on it. It is a real biyatch sometimes.
luv,
-Su

I have to agree there 2 GB of ram my system can handle 1.5 gb but my
OS(win ME) won't handle that so well by the way SU my Geforce 4 card is also
64 MB I couldn't afford the 128 mb card
